result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Treshon Marquis Hill Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill Sr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Treshon Marquis Hill Sr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 18 pages) commencing 10-14-2022 by Debra A. Wisniewski.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 41:
Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill Sr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Treshon Marquis Hill Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Deputy S. Haw. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill Sr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Treshon Marquis Hill Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Hill was not scheduled to appear today from Dodge. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill Sr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Treshon Marquis Hill Sr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for State v. Lee Hearing.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter
Received and Filed. Request for Prompt Dispositiion Received 9-12-22

Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill Sr not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. And Dodge is unable to produce the defendant. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill not in court, defendant in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. SPD has failed to appoint counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JJM (dob 7/12/2000),;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Treshon Marquis Hill in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Treshon Marquis Hill appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 3, 4, and 5. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
